an8.89:4.1: “Mendicants, the Saṅgha may, if it wishes, instruct a mendicant who has eight qualities to perform an act of reconciliation.
an8.89:4.3: They try to prevent the lay people from getting material possessions. They try to harm lay people. They insult and abuse lay people. They divide lay people against each other. They criticize the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha. They don’t keep a legitimate promise made to a lay person.
an8.89:4.4: The Saṅgha may, if it wishes, instruct a mendicant who has these eight qualities to perform an act of reconciliation.
an8.89:5.1: The Saṅgha may, if it wishes, revoke the instruction for a mendicant who has eight qualities to perform an act of reconciliation.
an8.89:5.3: They don’t try to prevent the lay people from getting material possessions. They don’t try to harm lay people. They don’t insult and abuse lay people. They don’t divide lay people against each other. They don’t criticize the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha. They keep a legitimate promise made to a lay person.
an8.89:5.4: The Saṅgha may, if it wishes, revoke the instruction for a mendicant who has these eight qualities to perform an act of reconciliation.”
